bow: please help mommit my month old has up to 24 night awakenings and will only sleep in her stroller and am desperate for solutions and sleep desperately need your help mommit sobbing as write this apologize in advance for the length want to give you all the details and lack of fluency so sleep deprived can no longer think straight my baby girl is just shy of months old she has never been good sleeper at weeks she had few hour stretches in swing but since then the longest stretch she has slept is hours rare on nightly basis she wakes up crying anywhere from to 24 yes 24 times with the average being 12 16 times she almost always requires nursing to go back to sleep for 10 minutes lately around she wakes up and is up not crying just awake for to hours she will only sleep in her travel system have had no luck getting her to sleep longer than few minutes in her crib tried cosleeping for the first few months but it was no better and my husband never got any sleep she and have moved to the nursery with me on cot next to her travel system read no cry sleep solution and implemented many of the strategies but she just wakes up too many times to put sleep plan in place would literally have to be up all night long really really do want to let her cio ve tried the attended cio for few hours and just could take it she has bedtime routine and lovey she goes down around the same time every night 7:30 and wakes herself up around the same time every morning sometimes 7:30 if she up for that hour stretch put her down for naps as soon as she tired she had problem taking longer than 30 minute naps but ve been sitting in on part of the naps and rocking her stroller through the transitions so she beginning to nap longer but with no improvement in the night wakings have read and read and read and have never found description of baby waking this frequently which makes me feel even more alone and upset we tried having dad respond to her crying but he did handle it well and he has to work early we have no one else to help neither of us has family involved in our lives or friends in position to help and she cries when stranger comes near her she is ebf and only just now is beginning to accept bottle but will only eat an ounce or so over couple hours and then demands to be nursed beginning to really hate nursing and am considering switching to breastmilk in bottle to see if that will help considering starting rice cereal before bed as various people have been pushing for months but her doctor said not to do she has no symptoms of reflux she does seem to have belly ache do consume gluten or dairy she is happy during the day except for the tiredness of course feel like going to go insane so tired miss my husband miss my bed want to enjoy my baby and my other children there seems to be no end in sight do know what to do but ca keep doing this sometimes feel resentful and angry towards my beautiful baby though know it is obviously not her fault between night sleeping and naps my whole life is consumed by these sleep issues how do get her to sleep outside the stroller how do get her to sleep longer how can get my life back without making her suffer **tl dr my month old wakes up 24 times night including long stretch will only sleep in her travel system and am losing my mind and straining my marriage ** *edit bold tl dr **edit thank you sooo much for all the ideas and responses you are all so thoughtful am overwhelmed by all the support think that needed to hear that this is normal consequence of breastfeeding and attentive parenting and really appreciate all the strategies you have given me to try will keep you updated ** do have any advice but you have my deepest sympathies stay strong it will get better thanks sometimes the only thing that gets me through the night is thinking about my colicky baby who is now an and how fast the time has gone since then although not so fast during have you taken her to the doctor this does seem normal does she eat solid food yet will she take pacifier oh momma so sorry ca imagine do have any advice but rooting for you it so hard when you have no one else to help maybe co sleep onion in bed in her nursery have you tried that this was me my son would wake up every 20 mins until would just go into bed and bring him in when went to bed he would wake only once just thought he slept better when was there until one night he rolled over into his belly and slept hours straight realizes he slept better with me because he nursed and always ended up on his side then his belly he is now months old and we always put him down on his belly and does good hour stretch until go to bed know this goes against what we are told but it works would never do it unless knew he could roll over himself anyways we also have video monitor and am always watching him understand your frustration my little one is almost months and will only sleep in his carseat or his swing and he has to have bottle when he sleeps gave in tot he bad habits out of desperation for sleep and now we are working on breaking them first ve started breaking him of the bottle letting him eat to his hearts content while rocking him ad wrapped up in his blankets once he gets to point where he doesnt need the bottle to sooth himself to sleep then we will work on him falling asleep int crib instead of the swing starting with rocking him to almost sleep with his bottle and then laying him down in his crib with his night light shining on the ceiling he will watch it until he falls asleep it worked once or twice but the big thing is that he has to be swaddled he will flail his arms to stay awake so when we swaddle him he stays asleep hope these tips help also have been told no to the foods for while but finally followed my gut we started oatmeal with fruit puree in it at about months and we do that in mid morning and my little man goes down for hours nap in the early afternoon it could be that she is getting the basic nourishment she needs from your breast milk but that she is still hungry after you could try adding just an oz or so of oatmeal to her diet would suggest taking her to doctor my middle child slept like that terribly she ended up having silent reflux and it was painful for her to sleep or lay down that is why she never slept or slept for long periods of time it was super hard to diagnose her because she slowly gained weight and never spit up or had any typical symptoms of reflux so triple check it is not some medical issue and give yourself lots of praise dealing with lack of sleep for that long of period is nothing short of miracle yes was going to suggest that twin mattress on the floor of the nursery for while and holy shit this sounds awful am so sorry this was exactly our first son slept horribly until we put him down on his stomach and then ta da my daughter was like that and even at 18 months is still terrible sleeper at her worst though it turned out she had teeny tiny yeast rash in her folds which was spotted by the doctor at her six month checkup week of cream and she would sleep sometimes up to hours all together also second the lady who said tummy sleeping big help same with mine tummy sleeper all the way from the beginning my month old is breast fed but eats single grain oatmeal or rice cereal plus random fruits or veggies it definitely lets him sleep better at night think he stays full longer have read that breast milk digests faster than formula and food so maybe your little one is just hungry also have to say my little guy never slept well on his back my mil put him on his tummy for nap and it was like lightbulbs went off he slept so much better and is hard to argue with that sincerely hope you find something that works for you stay strong momma so your not doing any solids at all both my kids started solids between months my dr told me to give our son more solids because he was poor sleeper do know why your dr would want you to try at all but it certainly not going to hurt dr really do know everything and if you ask ten different doctors why your kids not sleeping you ll get ten different answers had dr tell me my kids were ready to forward face at months because they were over 20lbs and different dr harassed me at every visit about my yr old not being potty trained before he was follow your gut mama try some cereal before bed if it were me that sounds like adoctor needs to investigate have read that kids can get something like restless leg syndrome which is hard to diagnose but makes them ready uncomfortable if they stop moving to sleep might be worth asking your doctor especially if you or hubby have it this does sound normal hang in there and get help if you can wow poor mom would talk more to the doctor about this because it sounds little out of the realm of normal do have much advice just wanted to say hang in there and whoever said twin mattress on the floor that sounds like good idea to me good luck and hope you get some rest and while thinking about it have friend whose daughter has disorder forget which one that has always had sleep issues like this is there any chance something like that is at play would give this try get an angelcare breathing monitor if you are concerned about sids this is not normal just for comparison with twins who were both lousy sleepers was up 15x night cio solved this problem have you consulted pediatric sleep specialist would ask your pedi for referral if you live anywhere near city the fact that your baby will only sleep in stroller makes me think there may be silent reflux issue among other things would think that she may not be getting enough to eat and might be hungry to start breastfeeding is great but if you are stressed and tired you might not be producing enough and you can always try supplementing and pumping to keep up supply and see if that is factor once you figure out feeding know you said you do want to cio but think at this point it might be an option my daughter always had to cry before falling asleep and sometimes babies cry in their sleep and are really awake because she not getting solid sleep she also probably extremely over tired and fatigued so fortunately solving one problem might snowball and fix other things oh goodness yes had forgotten how much belly sleeping helped us with our first instant longer and better sleeping with her have month old tummy sleeper too been that way since weeks can she roll over know every child is different but my girl could roll over one way at almost months and she would just roll onto her tummy and that was that she never sleeps on her back also my doctor said could give her solids at months if she was ready maybe it time for you to test the water with solid foods like rice cereal you mix it with your breastmilk oh man so sorry to hear it so hard when little one is supposed to be loved and yet they cause so much stress agree with others saying you need to start out with solids that certainly helped with being fuller for longer also tummy sleeping will help big time had forgotten until reading other comments and truly was amazed at how much better she slept with naps and night time hopefully that will help though know someone who daughter slept horribly and had sleep coach since this age or months they are looking into taking out dairy and gluten but since you do eat them do see how that might help you is there anything else that you eat that might bother your daughter found could eat any onions with both of my kids my heart goes out to you and so sorry you have to go through this its really hard with bad sleepers hope things get sorted out and quickly my daughter had reflux too and preferred to sleep in her car seat until she was or months does yours sleep in the car well my daughter preferred to be moving when she slept so she usually fall asleep in her swing or stroller and have to be moved later funny because my son gets motion sickness and screamed like banshee in his car seat and hated the stroller and swing oh boy do feel your pain have now 17 month old that was the worst sleeper ever and awoke 10 20 times night up until about months of age it agony and incredibly stressful my advice would be to first try and figure out exactly why is she waking up so often you can often tell by the way she cries out does it seem like pain colic reflux hard to sometimes tell and may be good to get full checkup with this in mind hunger separation anxiety from you if it reflux or colic issue this can be remedied but you may still have major problems due to the habit she has of waking so often this was my problem our little guy started out with nasty colic for the 1st months but when that eased he was still waking thousand times due to habit and just wanting to hang out with mommy like before if it hunger cry you may want to introduce some solids during the day six months is usually fine to do this just some simple purees and such even few bites day may make difference in how full she feels at night if the waking problem is like mine and you have beautiful precious but stubborn little baby that does sleep well this may be tough road read every book tried every technique for weeks and weeks was firmly against crying it out or anything like that but it got to the point where my husband and were losing our minds the sleep deprivation becomes mental and physical torture was functioning well and we both were becoming zombie parents not good it was the hardest decision but did eventually do modified cry it out at months after week of hell it worked not saying this is the way for you or anyone else it just my experience with difficult sleeper hang in there promise you will sleep again and soon this was all less than year ago and it now feels like decades away they grow so fast that this will feel like blink of the eye someday hi mommy first off hang in there you are stressed and exhausted and when that happens tears are inevitable and its really hard to think straight and come up with plan take deep breath you will get this figured out this is my two cents but not expert these are just thoughts coming from me both as mom and as medical student who has worked 36 hour shifts and knows what real sleep deprivation feels like take the babe to the doc make sure there is nothing going on like reflux etc this way if she is crying and waking up you know there is nothing seriously wrong that is causing pain suffering you wo feel guilty when she cries because you know there is nothing that needs to be fixed you wo lie in bed worrying yourself to death and instead you can tell yourself my baby is fine she is just learning to fall asleep and that is hard if there is nothing medically wrong with your baby then crying is not suffering if they are healthy have eaten and have dry diaper there is nothing wrong with crying this is their only method of communication struggled with this big time most moms do when we started sleep training my son we started when he was around mo old was tired and exhausted and when he would cry going to bed would break down in tears every time because felt like was failing my poor baby my husband was the strong one and would help me through it one night just could do it any more so we turned the baby monitor off and turned the tv on he cried for 40 minutes and then went to sleep after weeks of his bedtime routine he stopped crying and now goes straight to sleep every night bath lotion and change nurse short book cuddle and listen to one song on pandora bedtime if he does fall right to sleep he talks to the toys hanging from his crib until he is ready to sleep something that worked for me during those first few really hard nights was setting timer for 20 minutes he would start crying and would start the timer would listen to music watch tv take shower do laundry anything but listen to him crying then if he was still crying after 20 minutes would go pick him up and hold him rock him cuddle etc and calm him down then put him back in bed and let him try to fall asleep on his own again some nights it took few times but eventually he would fall asleep it was perfect but it helped me not to feel like was allowed to comfort my crying baby while still teaching him to self soothe and learn to fall asleep on his own in terms of the night awakenings would think not sleeping in the same room with her will make huge difference my doctor actually suggested this to me when was exhausted and stressed had trouble with this too but my husband finally drew the line and basically said to me you need to sleep need you in my bed and he is full and nothing is hurting him he will figure it out this is true you need sleep babies are super loud sleepers and often wake at night even for few minutes but then go back to sleep chances are you are noticing her waking up million times because you are sleeping right next to her second she probably has learned to self soothe so when she wakes up she ca fall back asleep she is months and should be able to go at least hours until needing to eat after she goes down go to bed with your husband set an alarm and go to her after hours if she wakes up and cries she will learn to self soothe and go back to sleep instead of expecting you to help her it is not hurting her would get up with my son 10 times when he was sleeping in our room when we moved him only got up times because would respond until he was clearly awake and hungry ie loud not just awake and wanting me to hold him these are just my thoughts but of course this is your baby and you need to do what is right for you family and not an expert thought cio and sleeping in separate rooms was the worst idea ever until go to the end of my rope then made the leap because had nothing left to try so happy did and wish someone had told me to do it sooner you can make it through this you are just too tired right now to feel like you can once you get some sleep this wo feel as formidable also got the book baby 411 which was the best 10 ever spent tldr if there is nothing medically wrong and she is tired fed and dry you might just have to let her cry it out but do not listen to it for an hour because you will go crazy do sleep in the same room set and alarm and go to her after hours when you know she should be hungry otherwise you will wake up with every twitch she makes regardless of whether she needs your or not agree here my son did sleep through the night until he happened to end up on his tummy one night never looked back and his pedi did seem all that concerned either especially since he could lift his head on his own my daughter started off good sleeper and then at months she started to wake up during the night know that if get lot of exercise during the day sleep like rock moved my daughter body around doing lay down sit up stand up things with her we also did lot of jumping where be like her personal johnny jumper after doing this for about an hour in the evening while before bed she be tuckered out not sure if this is going to help but good luck and just remember that it may not be soon but some day it will be better bingo do have pediatrician but general practitioner who has been my family doctor my entire life and he is much more relaxed he is very follow your gut kind of guy have you tried the happiest baby on the block http www youtube com watch v=dvaayxz6iuu or secrets of baby whisperer http www amazon com secrets baby whisperer connect communicate dp 0345479092 ref=sr ie=utf8 amp qid=1358655564 amp sr=8 amp keywords=secrets+of+the+baby+whisperer both have worked extremely well for us good luck and remember your baby loves you my son was like this until months when he was diagnosed with silent reflux and medicating that helped immensely but he did actually start getting better with sleep until he was diagnosed with sensory processing disorder and under the care of an occupational therapist this may not be the case for your daughter but if your gut is that there is something wrong follow it know it hard to think coherently when you re functioning on so little sleep but that is not normal sleep behavior there may be something bothering her if your pediatrician is out of answers then would make it priority to start talking to specialists pm me if you ever need to chat there are few people in the world who can understand that level of sleep deprivation it can be very isolating it definitely sounds like you need some respite know its not solution but it sounds to me like you could really use night off there definitely an end in sight this wo last forever yeah do really get this whole ask your pediatrician before you do anything way of life grew up in small town with about gp we saw the dr if we were sick needed shots or physical that about it when hear one of my mommy friends say our pediatrician did allow that it makes me cringe we ve moved times in years so ve gone through my fair share of dr they all have lots of opinions and ideas but at the end of the day it your kid my own mom tried to get me to start cereal at weeks old lol did listen to her but it never even occurred to me check with the dr before did it at months so so sorry you must be so tired my heart goes out to you my baby sleeps really well when put him down full and swaddled with pacifier he months swaddled really tight swear by this we also use sound machine free app that downloaded on my iphone to help him sleep better it keeps him from waking with sudden noises he usually goes down around 11pm and sleeps until 6:30am good luck and please update take her to the doctor immediately if the doctor says nothing is wrong go to another doctor also you might be able to get some professional advice from place like this http www sleephaven ca you have gotten some really good advice here in addition to that strongly recommend that you work on you getting some sleep even if you have solved baby problems that means your husband needs to step up sleep deprivation is form of torture and it clear from your post that you are suffering so two points on this first your husband *will* figure out how to handle the baby better if given the opportunity and if he puts some effort into it will it be the way you would do it likely not and that ok daddits generally do things little differently from the mommits babies somehow survive second what works for us is to take shifts am on until am and then bean dad takes over only waking me if nursing is required this allows me to get few hours of solid sleep before have to go to work enabling me to function since your husband has to work early maybe he could take the shift and you could take the shift look get that you want to let your husband sleep as much as possible and that thoughtful of you my husband needs more sleep than do to function and want him to have it notice who has the long shift at my house but it just not smart to try to deal with such difficult situation completely on your own do be that mommy that puts everyone first so much that you re completely used up you wo be helping anyone in the long run rice cereal edit had big long answer and then reread your post rice cereal works she is hungry does she watch you when you eat does she look like she could dig in if you let her 90 of all books have read doctors have seen and people have talked to say that months is when you start introducing solid food can you sleep when you are hungry ca edit saw the karma loss coming when edited the first time around all of this it took me until my son was 10 months old and finally got referral to pediatric gi for my son to get diagnosed officially with silent reflux he started medication little over month ago and oh my gosh he is different baby he cried all the time he woke up at night so much and now he is calm and happy and sleeps well am really sad that it took so much for me to get him help but op please go to the doctor if your doctor says she fine take her somewhere else the only symptom my son had was he would arch his back while nursing well that and the crying all the time good luck op keep us updated my heart goes out to you my son went through colicky phase and it was terrible he would cry most of the day forget how long this phase was but it was long enough to take toll on my sleep and emotions get second opinion even if it is nothing at least you have peace of mind if it is something then you can take steps to make it better wish got second opinion it would have kept me from worrying as much is there sleep clinic nearby might be worth try along with the suggestion to be checked for medical problems and introducing solids best of luck lt please do assume because she is breastfeeding that the baby must be waking hungry the baby has been poor sleeper since the beginning she has been gaining weight and growing and by months the mother supply is well established man thought had it rough feel for you mama my son is now months old and wakes anywhere from 12 times night between 7p 7a he too sometimes wakes up at 5a and is just awake our reason of why he wakes is he needs to eat know he needs to eat because he refuses to eat much during the day for example today he woke up at 7a and did until 3pm then again at 5p and again at when put him down we ve been up times so far tonight so he could eat he breastfed and always has been when introduced baby cereal it did nothing fed him at dinner time right before bed and it made no difference what so ever the only thing that did happen was had lil boy who screamed bloody murder every time tried to feed him purées we started at months and gave up at around months then reintroduced solids at months but instead tried baby led weaning this let him control the food and he no longer cries unless god forbid make the mistake of trying to feed him something myself when we started the baby led weaning and he actually ate food it cut the night time waking from about 12 down to although we still occasionally have bad night however the solid food does make up for the fact that he does nurse much during the day and seeing as how he needs to eat the only thing that helps is co sleeping he usually only naps for 30 40 mins if lucky my son is also just terrible night sleeper and occasionally has night terrors which started around months really young for them but had them as kid too because of this it just so much easier to co sleep nurse laying down stopped fighting trying to get him into crib gave up trying to let him cio he cries so hard he stops breathing for seconds at time and sweats profusely cosleeping and nursing at night is the only way we get the most amount of sleep maybe get bed in the nursery you can both share instead of the cot and crib found the more fuss that had to be made picking up from crib going to sit to nurse just made problems worse would say your best bet would be to check out sleep clinic or someone who specializes in infant children sleep problems would too but know the sources of my problem he just hungry do have much advice but just know you re not alone there are days snap because short on sleep and begging my husband to take the baby while nap for 20 mins it rough good luck to you *hugs* hang in there mama came here to say this silent reflux was our issue too it was horrible and know how you feel once she got on medication it was amazing the change my daughter was like this at months old she only slept in the stroller and we had to rock her with one foot to boot if your pedia finds nothing wrong then it is pretty much phase much like my daughter was she did wake up quite as often but she did wake up few times agree that maybe it is time to introduce some solids in her diet not big grain person for my children but try some of the lighter veggies fruits and do give her ones that are common allergens berries etc hate to be the bearer of bad news but this is something your babe needs to grow out of short of any medical issues and her hunger increasing my daughter is now nine years old so there is definitely light at the end of the tunnel nine year olds come with whole slew of other problems wish you the best of luck and you can message me if you have any questions how do they diagnose silent reflux have read about it and wondered if it was possibility but she does seem to have the symptoms listed except the lack of sleep and hiccups couple times day have taken her to doctors so far the first just said she has her days and nights mixed up and told me to give her formula before bed but still working on getting her to take bottle at all the 2nd doc was ridiculous he told me to stop demand feeding her to only feed her every hours during the day and only give her bottle of water at night my instincts said no may have to go to an out of town doc it sounds like she was months before she would take pacifier and after about weeks she was done with it how do you go about tummy sleeping do you wait until they re asleep before you put them down she used to being swaddled so not sure how should go about trying this thank you for the idea had really considered this with all the scary sids stuff they throw at us from the moment we re pregnant tried tablespoon of rice cereal before bed last night she was definitely ready for it ate it right up she seemed to sleep little better for the first few hours woke up times in hours but after that it was back to the usual ll keep trying though thank you we do have an extra mattress but might have to see if can get one really like to sleep with my husband at some point though lol but sleep in general would be great thank you it helps just knowing people care and can sympathize empathize thank you so much do feel like something is not right whatever it may be do feel like over attentive parenting so called has caused this as some people doctors have suggested thank you so much for caring and for your offer to chat it really means lot and yes it is sooo isolating you could try an aerobed not as much of commitment best prices on amazon hear you on the sleep we finally got my daughter to sleep out of our bed but still up 3x night with her so exhausted all the time so is my husband however we do get to snuggle nurse him to sleep and then as am walking over to the crib roll him over and place him in his crib going in head first found if placed his bottom half in first he would wake up maybe falling sensation then just keep my hand on his back for minute in case he wakes up hope that helps do hear the not getting enough to eat assessment lot not sure how to gauge that she eats until she does want to eat anymore she doubled her weight by months when she wakes at night she does take full feedings no matter how much try to get her to eat more to sustain her longer am hoping that by switching to giving her breastmilk from bottle that will have better idea how much she is consuming and when know exactly what you mean when your baby will only fall asleep one way it is hard not to go with it even if you know it might cause problems down the road they have to get sleep somehow after all so their development is affected it definitely helps her to be swaddled when she is swaddled it is much worse thanks for the tips interesting you should mention that have wondered if this is even possibility when put her in her crib to sleep she picks her legs up and slams them down repeatedly and it is almost as if the leg movements are waking her up have wondered if sleeping in the stroller keeps her legs more supported and still and that why she sleeps better she can roll front to back but not yet back to front it seems as if the tummy sleeping is popular recommendation so guess need to figure out how to implement that thank you for the time taken to respond did you feel as if your baby had any emotional after effects from the cio that is what am most worried about keep feeling like there must be some emotional consequences of my baby crying for me and being lonely and scared and me not responding to her and comforting her it is certainly possible though the doctors have talked to have said she is normal healthy baby outside of the sleep issues have wondered if maybe there is dietary culprit but as have already eliminated the big ones not really sure where to start suppose could try cutting out soy or eggs but since she has the problems every day and do eat the same things every day not sure if it would help could be worth try though it seems like she would have symptoms during the day though too if that were the case it is relief just hearing that someone else in the world has been through this thank you for your tips and ideas when you say modified cio what do you mean how did you go about it the challenge will be finding someone who will listen before they check off the standard baby is just feeding for comfort mother us over reacting etc and other mids information about breastfed children sick at it if you know something is wrong just keep at it till they listen fear that have made my husband sound bad in my op he does help me when ask for it but it is hard for me to ask him for help when can calm her down much more quickly than he can so dealing with the awakenings is much harder on him he does take over for couple hours on weekend mornings when he does have to work luckily quit my job after my maternity leave so it seems logical that would be the one to handle things should heed your advice not to be martyr however do wait too long and stretch myself too far before asking for help she does indeed watch us eat and even try to get food off our plates did start the rice cereal last night tablespoon before bed and she gobbled it up no help with the sleep issue yet but it was only the first feeding after all how much should be giving her tablespoon once day twice day two tablespoons do they do sleep studies on babies the ones in major medical centers certainly do think it is discribed by adults as tingling crawling aching etc by adults and from what remember it happens when ppl are tired night if they stop moving and start resting wish could remember where read the article post if do thank you so much for your thoughts and your post obviously feel for you too if you need someone to talk to pm me anytime as for the baby led weaning did even know that was an option doctors and magazines and such make us so terrified of food allergies and follow the single grain cereal first then another then single foods one at time mantra how did you start this what foods did you begin with or did you just give him what you were eating at every meal or just dinner *edit and *hugs* to you too my oldest son would sleep in anything but his car seat or his bouncer for about the first six months and then it was only for about 20 minutes per 24 hours not to scare you at all and do think it should but in our experience the lack of sleep and constant wakefulness was the first sign of the autism that was to come you might also want to push the doctor for an mri and extensive blood testing to rule out physical causes if it is illness injury or developmental disability then it is phase and she will grow out of it do you go to her every time she wakes up or do you give her the chance to soothe herself and try to go back to sleep on her own in our case my son father literally would not let me out of bed until he had been crying at least three minutes because my instinct was to go to him the minute he awakened we worked him up to about hours night where we still are currently by simply not going to him unless it was obvious that he would be up for little while not really letting him cry it out because after the first three minutes would go to him and help him out but many times he would put himself back to sleep after just minute or two do start the rice until the pediatrician says to it likely will only make things worse especially if her stomach rejects it however months old might be old enough to start some first solid foods but not through the bottle bad mom of the century did not even know until she was close to years old thought she had asthma or some lung issues with her chronic bronchitis and then terrible case of pneumonia the asthma allergy doctor looked down her throat and saw all the reflux damage within weeks of reflux medication she started sleeping through the night and having less tantrums all that time she cried and cried and never slept she was in pain just thought she was fussy baby she is almost years old and still feel guilty when started again at months it happened by chance was eating wedge of cantaloupe and he reached for it and sucked on it he gummed it to death naturally was but hesitant because it was huge wedge but he managed it quite well so bought the book baby led weaning by rapley very informative we stuck with cantaloupe since it obviously worked for him and then just gave him fruits and veggies some raw some cooked from the approved list the first few we re roasted sweet potato sticks steamed green beans ripe pears banana and cucumber which is also great for soothing upset gums we started with about one to two choices at time and worked up to more he typically has options at given time and its cute cuz you can see he has favorites broccoli cucumber and pears as he recognizes and reaches for those first it messy process at first so we started with just dinner time with bath right after we started breakfast at about months he usually will not nurse at all in the morning so he chows down at breakfast leave him in his pjs and then change him much easier that way about two weeks ago started to offer egg yolks know this can be high allergen but no one in our family is allergic so felt comfortable introducing it no whites as they do offer much nutrition wise and they are supposedly reassuring him that had not abandoned him and would still respond but he finally learned to settle himself after week or so hi again my son has been gaining as much weight and my doctor actually suggested we start solid foods and he is only months she told me there is actually some evidence out there that introducing some wheat around months decreases the risk of gluten intolerance celiac disease do have an article to back this up though there is no right way to start first foods you should avoid peanuts peanut butter and nuts nut butters because of the risk of an allergic reaction do give her honey because of the risk of botulism after that just try some pureed mashed stuff and stick with less than new foods per week and not all on the same day so if she has reaction rash or constipated also grabbed bananas sweet and avocados high in good fat and calories that will keep baby full you can also try full fat yogurt but my son did like it you can always get jarred baby food
